com.esri.mo2.client.sde
Class SdeConnection

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.client.sde.SdeConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connection
public class SdeConnection
extends Object
implements Connection

This connection provides access to the Content found in a single SDE instance that is accessed using the standard ArcSDE java api.

Constructor Summary
SdeConnection()
          null constructor required for obtaining content via an access string
SdeConnection(String server, int instance, String database, String username, String password)
          construct an SDE connection for given SDE server, instance, database, username and password parameters

Constructor Detail

SdeConnection

public SdeConnection()
null constructor required for obtaining content via an access string

See Also:
ContentUtility.accessContent(java.lang.String)

SdeConnection

public SdeConnection(String server,
                     int instance,
                     String database,
                     String username,
                     String password)
construct an SDE connection for given SDE server, instance, database, username and password parameters

Parameters:
server - the network name of the SDE server
instance - the port number of the SDE instance running on the server
database - the name of the database, or "" == no database (must not be null)
username - the login name
password - the corresponding password
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

Returns:
the network name of the SDE server

getInstance

public int getInstance()
Returns:
the port number of the SDE instance running on the server

getDatabase

public String getDatabase()
Returns:
the name of the database, on many systems, this can be null

toString

public String toString()
the connection string has the form

toStringWithoutPassword

public String toStringWithoutPassword()
similar to toString(), this method returns a String that is suitable for display in a user interface

Returns:

equals

public boolean equals(Object object)
Description copied from interface: Connection
this equals() functions the same way as Object.equals() but must not test for object equality (x == y). Implementations should test that the given object has the same implementation class as this Connection, then check that the Connection parameters are identical - or equivalently, the values returned from toString() are equal.

Specified by:
equals in interface Connection
Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
object - the other object to be compared for equality
Returns:
true if considered equal, false otherwise
See Also:
Object.equals(java.lang.Object), Connection.toString()

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Description copied from interface: Connection
a Connection must implement hashCode() to match the results of equals(), in order for SourceCache and CatalogModel to locate Connection objects within a HashMap

Specified by:
hashCode in interface Connection
Overrides:
hashCode in class Object
